DataElement.preferredName: Dentist Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Clinical Study Motivation Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the dentist's motiviation in research on pain from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dentist Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Clinical Study Motivation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the dentist's motiviation in research on pain from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Concepts.definition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Property.preferredName: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Clinical Study Motivation
Property.preferredDefinition: Any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :The psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.

Concepts.definition: A disorder that affects the masticatory muscles and temporomandibular joint.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
